noun.description: An area of woodland in which the trees or shrubs are, or formerly were, periodically cut back to ground level to stimulate growth and provide firewood or timber.

verb.description: Cut back (a tree or shrub) to ground level periodically to stimulate growth.
examples: the company began to coppice the woodland for conservation purposes
coppicing is sustainable and doesn't threaten the environment

origin: Late Middle English: from Old French copeiz, based on medieval Latin colpus a blow (see cope). Compare with copse.
